ygData.authorName: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)
ygData.from: "Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)" <g4mntofcr@...>
ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Pixie Fix???
ygData.msgSnippet: In the immortal words of Gomer Pyle: Fool me once shame on you.  Fool me twice shame on me. I for one do not expect to see any improvements made to the bard
ygData.messageBody:
In the immortal words of Gomer Pyle:

Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me.

I for one do not expect to see any improvements made to the bard class ever
again. Much easier to not get disappointed/frustrated when your
expectations are low to start with.

Galtin of E'ci (bet you thought this was Kitasi posting:-)


-----Original Message-----
From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 24, 2000 9:34 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Pixie Fix???


Has John(tm) once told me, 'Your problem is you still have hope".

If they do fix it so we can keep 2-3 mobs locked down I will be one of the
first to thank them.

I am not getting my hopes up.

Rokenn

> Message: 11
> Date: Tue, 24 Oct 2000 08:29:22 CDT
> From: "Olgwinn Pendragun" <olgwinn@...>
> Subject: Pixe Strike to be fixed? Possible 49th song???
>
> Title says it all; here's Absor's post:
>
>
> We are looking into a few bardic changes. Nothing is set in stone yet on
> this, it still has to be reviewed, but I thought I'd let you know what
> we're
>
> thinking about. We are thinking about reducing secondary resists for
> targeted mesmerize songs (with the possibility of a new song along these
> lines). There are some other potential changes that we are considering,
> but
> I'll have to tell you about them after we have a chance to talk them over
> further.
>
> Alan
